comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Lavinia "Vinnie" Ream Hoxie (1847-1914) was a sculptor, first woman to win a commission from the US Government to create a statue (of Lincoln, after his assassination): she also sculpted portraits of Admiral Farragut and Sequoyah. She's buried at Arlington National Cemetery. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vinnie_Ream

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Apparently the Bain News Service circulated this photo of Ream-Hoxie to its clients at the time of her death -- January 12, 1914. She is buried in Arlington National Cemetery. And the town of Vinita, Oklahoma, was named in her honor (although she was a Wisconsin native).

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: pennylrichardsca and Wystan:  Thank you for the additional information about Lavinia Hoxie. We will add some of it to the record when we update.
